descriptionSet.description: Denis Diderot, a key figure in the advancement of Enlightenment philosophy, became connected to the Encyclopedie in 1746. The prospectus promised that the encyclopedia would be a "Chart of the Branches of Human Knowledge," which Diderot described as "the Genealogical Tree of All the Arts and Sciences." Based on the assumption that all knowledge comes from sensations, the Système figuré groups all learning under memory (history), reason (philosophy) or imagination (poetry).
